敵.definition: (bound form) enemy; (bound form) to be a match for; to rival; (bound form) to resist; to withstand

敵害.definition: pest; vermin; animal that is harmful to crops or to another species; enemy; predator

敵後.definition: (military) the enemy's rear; behind enemy lines

敵情.definition: the situation of the enemy positions; intelligence about the enemy

敵我矛盾.definition: contradictions between ourselves and the enemy; Either you are for us or against us.

敵手.definition: opponent; substantial adversary; worthy match; antagonist; in the enemy's hands

敵敵畏.definition: (loanword) DDVP, aka dichlorvos (an organophosphate used as an insecticide)

敵檔.definition: rival productions (of the same opera in neighboring theaters)

敵特份子.definition: enemy agents in our midst; reds under the beds

敵百蟲.definition: trichlorphon C4H8Cl3PO4, organic phosphate used as insecticide; also called dipterex

敵眾我寡.definition: multitude of enemies, few friends (idiom from Mencius); heavily outnumbered; beaten by the weight of numbers

敵臺.definition: defensive tower; lookout tower; enemy radio station

敵視.definition: hostile; malevolence; antagonism; to view as enemy; to stand against
